results.content:
In terms of course content, I am quite happy with the course. Contents are well-designed and in-depth. The part that impresses me the most is the coding demonstration. In most courses, coding demo is just a code editor screenshot with instructor reading instructions. For students, this is just really to get lost. But this course has added lots of animated arrows and texts to help guide students. This is an excellent feature. It makes the whole coding demo much easier to follow. 
PS: just a personal advice: Premiere allows you to set a smooth transition for RGB keying. Setting it to smooth may help making animations look more refined.

results.content:
In short, this course solved my problem. 
I am a beginner. So how 'beginner' I am? 
Not too long ago, I still have no idea what the difference is between HTML, XHTML and HTML5. 
I knew some HTML and CSS tags. Given enough time, I can manage to create the page I want. But that is barely achieved using the trial and wrong method.  I applied a CSS code, but it wouldn't work. But I had no idea why it did not work. So I just try another CSS code. The result is I can 'eventually' create the page I want but the code is literally a mess. 
Thanks to this course, I finally developed a satisfactory command of HTML and CSS. I now know how to pick HTML and CSS tags for the right job. I still make mistakes occasionally, but my skills is now getting a lot better. 
This course gives you a very detailed explanation of commonly used HTML and CSS tags. It highlights all the minor but important differences and details for you. 
It also teaches you how to assemble those skills together. For beginners like me, this is exactly what I need.
You will learn new skills in a progressive way. The instructor will show you a problem first to raise your awareness. Then he will show you why you have this problem and how to fix and avoid it. 
Overall, I would definitely recommend this course to beginners.

results.content:
The course did touch upon many great topics, but I have a few complaints. 
- The instructors read out the letters of "div" and "app" as if they are acronyms instead of single words. anyone who would pronounce these things as acronyms would get laughed at in a professional setting.
- There are about 550 videos in this course now, some of them need to be merged together. there is no need to break up what would be a 4 minute video into 3 segments. there is no need to have videos that are 37 seconds in length.
- I might have missed something, but I didnt really see any cohesive way in which all of the technologies that were taught ever get used together.

That being said, this course does cover a hefty amount of topics in its run. You'll learn some HTML, CSS, Javascript (including both jQuery and Vue, which don't really play nice with each other), PHP, and MySQL. It's a perspective from both a client and a server angle.

At the beginning, I tried to learn from the Vue official manual. Big mistake! The manual requires far more IQ than I have.
Then, I tried youtube videos. Things were getting better, but not for long. When things started to get more challenging, I got stuck. I found myself watching the same video again and but just could not completely understand everything. 
Eventually, I decided to try paid courses. If this time it still did not work out, then bye bye Vue. 
At the beginning, I chose this course because it covers pretty much everything in web development. 
After watching the first few lessons, I was blown away!
I understood how the input box and the P tag stay in sync after only watching the lesson ONCE!
The animation has made the whole process extremely clear and easy to understand. It also leaves a strong impression as well. 
I have started the rest of the course, but at this moment, I am very happy with this course!
Thanks!

results.content:
The course teaches you new concepts in a progressive way. It first teaches you the most fundamental concepts and then ask you to do something slightly more complicated. Then you will find that you cannot do that or meet unexpected results. At this time, the instructor will show you what is wrong or what you need to learn next. I really love this way of teaching. 
In the Vue part, the instructor will first give you an APP structure and design analysis. Then he will show you how to create the APP from start to finish. He will show you how to make a simple APP first and then show you how to make it more complicated or how to make it more efficient. 
Using v-model on Vue components have been haunting me for a very long time as the Vue manual is being too 'concise' in this regard. Thanks to this course, my ordeal is finall over. THANKS!!! The instructor broke the whole APP into pieces and put them together at the end. It feels like watching a detective movie. All the preparation work is done without you noticing. At the last moment, everything starts to make sense right away. The part about naming the self-defined event: input and prop: value is just genius. All puzzles are solved instantly at the last moment. Most importantly, I now understood using v model on components!!!
